# selectedMessage

**Instance Property**

The message that the user selected in the conversation transcript.

## Declaration

```swift
var selectedMessage: MSMessage? { get }
```

## Discussion

If the user selected one of your extension’s messages in the conversation transcript, this property is set to the selected message object. Otherwise, it is set to `nil`.

If your extension was launched because the user selected the message, then this property is set when the extension is launched.

If the user selects a message while your extension is running, the system takes the following steps:

1. Invokes your [doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSMessagesAppViewController] object’s [doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSMessagesAppViewController/willSelect(_:conversation:)] method.
2. Updates the conversation’s `selectedMessage` property.
3. Invokes your [doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSMessagesAppViewController] object’s [doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSMessagesAppViewController/didSelect(_:conversation:)] method.

Override [doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSMessagesAppViewController/willSelect(_:conversation:)] or [doc://com.apple.messages/documentation/Messages/MSMessagesAppViewController/didSelect(_:conversation:)] to handle changes to the selected message while your extension is active.
